intro: Canscora heteroclita, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a succulent, hairy stem and produces small, green, egg-shaped leaves. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Canscora heteroclita is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
